comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: captain slack, I had a problem with your link. Maybe this will work better. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J._P._Morgan,_Jr.. [The problem was that the Wikipedia URL finishes with a period, but Flickr assumes that a period following a URL is not part of the URL!!!!] "John Pierpont ("Jack") Morgan, Jr. (September 7, 1867 — March 13, 1943) was an American banker and philanthropist. He was born in Chicago and graduated from Harvard in 1886, where he was a member of Delta Phi and Delta Kappa Epsilon. He was the son of banking tycoon, J. P. Morgan." Several other photos in this Bain batch are of his father's funeral. See www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/tags/jpmorganfu...

comment.author: 66384486@N00
comment._content:
I'm so glad I found this collection.
My grandmother worked at the company JP Morgan when she was just out of high school and met JP Morgan Junior (she took shorthand in the board rooms).  I can't wait to show her these pictures!  She'll definitely get a kick out of them.

comment.author: 31351245@N00
comment._content: Another fun fact - the building in the background (on the left) is now Poland's mission to the UN.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Anyone who has been to New York City should recognize the building. It is 225 Madison Avenue at 36th Street. It is the Morgan Library. The empty lot to the right now contains the modern addition to the museum. In the fictional account in Ragtime it is the place where Coalhouse Walker has his siege until his soiled car is cleaned and returned to him. Here it is in Google streetview: maps.google.com/maps?q=225+Madison+Avenue+at+36th+Street,... Here it is in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pierpont_Morgan_Library

comment.author: 61361160@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Architecture, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 46317563@N04
comment._content: This is the J.P. (Jack) Morgan Jr. residence at 228-231 Madison Avenue, southeast corner of 37th St. J.P. Morgan Sr. bought this house for Jack in 1904. Morgan Sr.'s house was on the northeast corner of Madison Avenue and 36th St. The Morgan Library's original entrance was on 33 E. 36th St. All three were connected by underground passageways. See digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?1557966 it shows all three structures, Madison Avenue is in the foreground and E. 36th St. is to the left of photo.As the complex grew with additional bldgs., the addresses were slightly changed over the years. I've never been to Manhattan,but I wish to go there someday. Book references: Empires of Light by Jill Jonnes -Random House 2003, They were Ragtime by Warren Forma - Grosset & Dunlap 1976
